lead_paragraph: Manufacturing exports and employment fell in January, though new orders grew for the first time since October. Construction spending rose 0.1 percent in December, helped by home building.

headline.print_headline: Slowdown for Factories in the U.S. and China
headline.main: Factory Activity Falls for 4th Straight Month, but Construction Edges Up

snippet: Manufacturing exports and employment fell in January, though new orders grew for the first time since October. Construction spending rose 0.1 percent in December, helped by home building.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports its manufacturing index rose to 48.2 in January from 48 in December; China reports factory activity dropped to lowest level in over three years; Commerce Dept reports construction spending rose 0.1 percent in December after drop in November.
